descript.abstract: Strategic Habitat Areas (SHAs) represent priority habitat areas for protection due to their exceptional condition or imminent threat to their ecological functions supporting estuarine and coastal fish and shellfish species. Identification and designation of SHAs is a goal of the North Carolina Coastal Habitat Protection Plan. This dataset represents areas that were nominated in region 1: Albemarle Sound to the northeastern coastal ocean of North Carolina. The identification of SHAs was conducted in a two step process: 1) using GIS-based habitat and alteration data in a computerized site-selection analysis, and 2) verifying and modifying information based on input from a scientific advisory committee. Staff and a scientific advisory committee specified representation levels for 42 habitat types, or natrual resource targets. There were also 18 alteration factors that were represented geospatially (i.e., hydrologic alterations, water quality degradation). The site selection program MARXAN was used to select areas that met representation levels while also minimizing alteration. The scientific advisory committee then modified the computer results based on their unique knowledge and experience. The resulting SHA nominations for 20 areas encompass approximately 20% of the entire area of natural resource targets in region 1. The SHAs were corroborated with biological data, ecological designations, and specific knowledge of the area. The SHA nominations will be incorporated into conservation and restoration planning efforts.
descript.purpose: This dataset represent areas that were nominated as Strategic Habitat Areas in region 1: Albemarle Sound to the northeastern coastal ocean of North Carolina. Details of the process for developing these boundaries can be found in the Strategic Habitat Area report for region 1, which can be downloaded from the NC Division of Marine Fisheries at http://ncfisheries.net/habitat/miscdownloads/SHA_region1_report_11_20_08.pdf. These boundaries represent Strategic Habitat Area NOMINATIONS. They have not been DESIGNATED in rule as of March 2012. Strategic Habitat Area boundaries may be designated in rule at a future date.

idinfo.useconst: None. Please check sources, scale, accuracy, currentness and other available information. Please confirm that you are using the most recent copy of both data and metadata. Acknowledgement of the NC Division of Marine Fisheries would be appreciated.

cntperp.cntorg: North Carolina Division of Marine Fisheries - Habitat Protection Section

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.1.0.722

dataqual.logic: Ground truthing still needs to be performed to ensure that natural resource targets and alterations used to create these boundaries are true.
dataqual.complete: These boundaries represent Strategic Habitat Area NOMINATIONS. They have not been DESIGNATED in rule as of March 2012. Strategic Habitat Areas may be designated in rule at a future date.

horizpa.horizpar: These boundaries were created using multiple data sources of varying accuracy.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: ID number for each Strategic Habitat Area. These numbers represent those listed in the region 1 report.
Description of each Strategic Habitat Area location. These descriptions represent those listed in the region 1 report.
Acreage of each Strategic Habitat Area.
Hectares of each Strategic Habitat Area

cntorgp.cntorg: NC Center for Geographic Information and Analysis

distinfo.distliab: NCCGIA is charged with the development and maintenance of NC OneMap and, in cooperation with other mapping organizations, is committed to offering its users accurate, useful, and current information. Although every effort has been made to ensure the accuracy of information, errors and conditions originating from physical sources used to develop this dataset may be reflected in the data supplied. The user must be aware of possible conditions and bear responsibility for the appropriate use of the information with respect to possible errors, original map scale, collection methodology, currency of data, and other conditions specific to certain data. NCCGIA does not support secondary distribution of this dataset without its current, compliant metadata record. The use of trade names or commercial products does not constitute their endorsement by NCCGIA or North Carolina State Government.

stdorder.fees: None. Download from www.nconemap.com is free of charge.

distinfo.custom: Data can be customized on a cost-recovery basis. Contact dataq@its.nc.gov or 919-754-6580 for more information.
distinfo.techpreq: All formats available from www.nconemap.com are in ESRI shapefile. Other formats are available on a cost-recovery basis - contact dataq@its.nc.gov or 919-754-6580 for more information. Format compatibility is the user's responsibility.
